node.title: Being Bluey's dad for one day busted some big parenting myths for me
node.description: In the interest of family experimentation and likely award-winning-journalism, I decided to spend an entire day trying to match Bandit's legendary dad energy by agreeing to do whatever my kids wanted, for as long as they wanted.
node.content:
["It's a gorgeous, sunny day in Brisbane \u2014 the sky is startlingly blue, my two little girls are squealing happily, and I'm rapidly losing my grip on reality.", "For the past 45 minutes, we've been playing Daddy Monster at the playground. It involves me roaring at the kids and chasing them, and them screaming and running away.", "There's not much sport in the chasing because they're slow. It's more about me running just slow enough to not catch them.", "", "
Bandit's patience and energy are boundless. But he's also a dog.\u00a0(Supplied: Ludo Studios)
", "And that's it, that's the game. My children are having a whale of a time, escaping down the slides and hurtling around the swings.", "Other random kids are now calling me Daddy Monster. Their parents are laughing at me. It feels like we've been playing for an eternity.", "Why am I doing this?", "Because I love my kids and would do anything to make them happy.", "Why am I really doing this?", "Because I want to see if I can be as good at parenting as Bandit. You know, Bluey's dad.", "", "
A child psychologist says the notion that we should play with our kids all the time is a relatively new one.(ABC News: Alive Pavlovic)
", "The cartoon beautifully showcases imaginative kids' play and aspirational parenting.", "Bandit and Chilli (the mum) are incredible parents to their two cheeky and creative daughters, Bluey and Bingo.", "It's hard not to feel envious of them with their endless well of fun to draw on.", "And yes, I realise how dumb it is to be jealous of cartoon dogs who live in a series of seven-minute vignettes, but here we are.", "", "
The kids embraced the opportunity to do whatever they wanted all day.(ABC News: Dan Colasimone)
", "So, in the interest of family experimentation and likely award-winning-journalism, I decided to spend an entire day trying to match Bandit's legendary dad energy by agreeing to do whatever my kids wanted, for as long as they wanted.", "If this was an episode of Bluey it would be called \"Yes Day\".", "Here's what I learnt along the way.", "
Being engaged vs being their personal court jester
", "", "
It's common\u00a0for parents to feel guilty that they aren't spending enough quality time with the kids.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "Usually, mornings are a blur. My wife and I are sploshing the kids' breakfast onto the table, and barking orders at them while getting ready ourselves.", "It's only when I've bid them adieu and am driving to work I realise I barely had a chance to chat to them to see what's up.", "Then in the afternoons, one of us has rushed home to get them and now have to prepare dinner, bathe them and put them to bed, all while they're craving our undivided attention.", "We both get pangs of guilt that we're not focusing enough attention on the kiddos.", "Parents who have spent long stretches working from home and/or homeschooling their kids during the pandemic know very well that the quantity of time together doesn't necessarily result in more quality time.", "Conveniently for this experiment, I already spend every Tuesday looking after the kids while my wife works.", "But this Tuesday, when four-year-old Mae asked what we're going to do, the answer's a bit different: whatever they want.", "First, two-year-old Rafi suggests, nay demands, babychinos \u2014 with marshmallows on the side of course. They both make a mess of themselves and the cafe, but that's nothing new.", "Returning home after their milk and sugar hit, apparently there's time for some crafting before we head out to Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary.", "Then, out of the blue: \"Daddy, we're going to Horsey's underwater sea map.\"", "OK. Let's go with this instead.", "So, we played the weird map game for a long time without me having any idea what is going on. Something about rescuing various sea critters.", "Whatever. They both seemed to enjoy it and the fact I was very involved.", "In these situations, I find if I just switch off most of my cognitive function and go with the flow, I tend to have a pretty good time as well.", "", "
Mae demonstrating an incomprehensible game involving her horse and sea creatures.(ABC News: Dan Colasimone)
", "Child psychologist Cathy McMahon says the notion that we should be playing with our kids all the time is a relatively new one.", "\"Realistically, parents can't be actively engaged with their children 100 per cent of the time and nor do they need to be,\" she says.", "\"In the past, young children would often just be alongside their parents (or grandparents), like 'apprentices', watching them do the chores, hanging out washing, cooking, shopping, chatting to neighbours, working in the fields.\"", "In many cultures, this is still the way daily life with kids plays out, Professor McMahon explains.", "I can imagine my own kids loving this setup, kicking stones and chewing on a piece of straw as I till the fields, asking inane questions all the while ('What's irrigation?', 'Why are you sweating so much?').", "As for watching parents scrolling through their phones?", "Not so interesting, Professor McMahon says.", "
Scheduling them in sounds weird but can work
", "Professor McMahon says there's no need to be 100 per cent responsive to your kids for extended periods.", "\"A whole day is a big ask!\" she says, swatting aside my whole concept in a single sentence.", "", "
Dave McCormack admires the way Bandit manages to make lying on the couch part of many of the games.(Supplied: Ludo Studios)
", "She has a better suggestion for parents.", "\"Perhaps try a more achievable and modest goal. One approach that can be really effective is to 'book an appointment' with your child \u2013 one-on-one, for maybe just 20 minutes,\" she says.", "\"During those 20 minutes, try to be completely available (no phone, no alternative agenda); just sit down in the child's space (perhaps their bedroom) and let them lead.", "\"Don't make suggestions or give instructions or ask questions; just watch and follow where the child goes \u2013 it can be very powerful.", "\"The child may initially be astonished. They really notice and savour the emotional 'presence' and it becomes a very rich experience for both \u2013 the parent just watching and following where the child takes them.\"", "But it doesn't have to be like that the whole time, she adds.", "", "
Custard frontman and the voice of Bluey's dad Bandit, Dave McCormack.(Supplied: Ludo Studios)
", "Bandit-for-real-life (aka the bloke who voices the character) Dave McCormack, agrees.", "He tells me it's hard to maintain enthusiasm for long periods.", "\"He's the coolest dad. Actually, it's the coolest family.", "\"I feel a little guilty after doing an episode [voicing Bandit] and am briefly inspired to do some papier-m\u00e2ch\u00e9 or play keepy-uppy with the kids, be more engaged with them. But after a couple of hours, I go back to the default of just doing a little less and letting them watch TV or whatever.", "
Sometimes kids need direction, sometimes they should go their own way
", "", "
Rafi would have kept this game up forever if given the chance.(ABC News: Dan Colasimone)
", "Once the \"horse-map-sea creature\" game was over we finally get motivated enough to go to Lone Pine.", "This is a regular jaunt for us as we've got a family pass, so I'm never too worried about how focussed the kids are.", "With all decisions left up to them, however, this was a particularly meandering effort.", "We saw the Tassie devils and koalas and got uncomfortably close to the dingos, but the bulk of our morning was spent going in and out of the little children's doors at the entrance to the kangaroo area.", "Seriously.", "Rather than looking at cute animals they preferred to go in and out the doors, saying \"I'm going to work\", then coming back and repeating the whole thing.", "", "
Even more fun than feeding kangaroos is playing in the doorway of the kangaroo area.(ABC News: Dan Colasimone)
", "The only way the game ended was when Mae finally got sick of it. If it had been up to Rafi she might still be there, opening and closing the little doors until the end of time like a cheeky, cherubic\u00a0Sisyphus.", "I could already feel my brain switching to low-battery mode, perhaps threatening to switch itself off entirely due to the tedium.", "", "
Bandit also shows incredible patience with his kiddos.(Supplied: Ludo Studios)
", "McCormack says he has nowhere near the stamina of Bandit, even if many of the Bluey episodes mirror his own parenting experiences.", "He cites The Pool and Movies episodes as examples of experiences he's lived with his own kids.", "\"The cinema episode, for example, it happened exactly that way to me maybe six months before we worked on the episode,\" he says.", "\"And my wife said 'are you sure you're not putting in ideas for these episodes? Because it sounds just like you'.", "\"But it's just that it must be these universal experiences that we all go through, we think we're going it alone but everyone is experiencing the same thing.", "\"But you've got to realise that you can't do it all, it's short bursts with me before I need a break.\"", "
Children need the confidence to fail
", "", "
There was some semblance of \"quiet time\" to have a little break.(ABC News: Dan Colasimone)
", "For us, it's back home for lunch, and nap time for Rafi (non-negotiable) while Mae drew pictures of butterflies and vegetables.", "When Rafi woke up we stuck stickers all over cardboard, them and me.", "As the day rolls on it becomes apparent that in agreeing to every childish whim, the pile of dirty clothes at the top of the stairs remains there, sadly looking at me, and the house more and more resembles a war zone.", "As we move hyperactively from one activity to the next, there is certainly no time to clean up the mess we just made.", "My wife, when she gets home, isn't going to like my \"don't worry, it's for an experiment\" explanation of why the living room looks like Leicester Square after England lost the final of the Euros.", "But Professor McMahon has a solution for that.", "She suggests getting the kids involved in the chores wherever possible.", "\"If parents can take opportunities to include their kids in those day-to-day chores, that can be a useful time for conversation and interaction \u2013 and still leave space for parents and children to pursue their own independent activities,\" she says.", "Time-poor parents should pick their moments to engage with the kids, she explains.", "And she says parents need to learn to read their child's emotional cues.", "\"If the child is distressed, tired, unwell, they need more focused attention and support to get their emotions back on an even keel,\" she says.", "", "
Time-poor parents should pick their moments to engage with the kids.(ABC News: Alive Pavlovic)
", "\"At other times, however, kids need their parents to encourage their independence and exploration.", "\"Children need the space and confidence to go out, try things on their own, and sometimes fail.", "\"It provides the opportunity to develop a sense of self-esteem as a competent person.", "\"Getting this balance right is the key challenge for parents, especially when they are trying to juggle work commitments as well.\"", "
Parents should go easy on themselves
", "", "
Bandit seems to have a never-ending supply of energy to play with his kids.(Supplied: Ludo Studios)
", "For our final jolly of the day it's out to the local park, where Mae rides her bike. Then we have our long, long session of Daddy Monster, before finally heading home and winding down for the day.", "Even the kids themselves are cooked by 4:30pm.", "Having run out of steam completely, they're happy to zonk out on the couch in front of the TV for a while before dinner.", "I need to zonk out too, but there was still the regular evening jobs to take care of. A glass of wine would have to do for now.", "Professor McMahon says you don't need to guilt-trip yourself about not always being available for the little ones.", "\"Parents need to be nurtured themselves if they are to provide for their children's needs without becoming exhausted,\" she says.", "\"They need some time out to rest and recover, and that's what is frequently lacking with the additional pressures of working from home, with children always there.", "", "
Children, just like their parents, need time to rest and recover.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "Guilt is understandable, but not very useful, she says.", "\"Parents all wonder if they're getting it right, and if they're doing enough,\" she says.", "\"It's not easy, and parents need to be compassionate with themselves. No parent gets it right all of the time \u2013 and the good news is, they don't have to.", "\"The notion of 'good-enough' parenting is helpful and liberating.\"", "Bandit-for-real-life agrees.", "\"Just do what you can! Do what feels right.", "\"Nobody can be everything to their kids all the time, so do your best,\" McCormack says.", "And I'm more than happy to take Bandit's advice on this one."]
